metadata.title: CVE-2023-0702 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in Data Transfer in Google Chrome prior to 110.0.5481.77allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UIinteractions to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
